title: Two Fingers Amulet
description:
A black glass amulet in the form of two fingers of the right hand. The finger joints are indicated as well as the cuticles.
Condition: Perfect. Traces of yellowish dirt (?) at separation of fingers.

completeness.name: Best
completeness.description: All data has been vetted. Objects generally have quality photos and descriptions.

labels.content: A detailed likeness of the index and second fingers of the right hand was one of the many amulets placed on the mummy. This amulet was meant to close the incision through which the embalmers removed internal organs from the body prior to mummification. Remains of the resin used during embalming are still visible between these fingers. In addition to offering protection, an amulet of this shape was meant to help the deceased function better in the afterlife.

collections.name: Egyptian, Classical, Ancient Near Eastern Art

exhibitions.title: Body Parts: Ancient Egyptian Fragments and Amulets
